Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Komast cup; interior: reserved band at lip, glazed black below; top of rim black; exterior: on offset lip, incised splinter rosette with added red on alternate petals; black band at top of handle zone, in which there is black-figure decoration consisting of part of dancing male figure to right (elbow and upper arm, back of head with fillet and hair tied near the end, and ear remaining); at left, part of incised spoked rosette with red centre and alternating petals.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 194, no. 4)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 368, no. B495)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0364) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 93, pl. II, no. 4)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
